alert.note: Alert for Kennebec; Knox; Lincoln; Sagadahoc; Waldo (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 20 at 11:32PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Maine, including the following counties, Kennebec, Knox, Lincoln, Sagadahoc and Waldo. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of low-lying, urban, and other flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Culvert washouts are possible. Flooding of waterways is expected to be brief and limited to smaller creeks and streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1130 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. For locations closer to Penobscot Bay, heaviest rain is expected shortly before dawn. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brunswick, Augusta, Bath, Rockland, Belfast, Gardiner, Camden, Damariscotta, Lincolnville and Wiscasset.
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
